data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3395614,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-05T16:02:41.828Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWell, the title pretty much says it all.  If a device on the robot sends a UDP packet to the local broadcast IP address, does that packet (a) make it all the way to the driver laptop, or (b) just stay on the robot?   [Ignoring the fact that UDP is unreliable.  Just want to see if it gets filtered.]\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-05T16:02:41.828Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467265,"topic_slug":"does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets/467265/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3395624,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-05T16:15:32.831Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWhen you say “broadcast”, are we talking like the wireless router/networking broadcast or like the video livestream for the event? Broadcast can mean a lot of different things.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-05T16:19:59.574Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467265,"topic_slug":"does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets/467265/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3395648,"name":"alst","username":"alst","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alst/{size}/11646_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-05T17:35:22.866Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’m guessing the former based on “UDP packet to the local broadcast IP address”.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMy basic understanding is that you may need to ensure that your packets have a TTL of at least 2 set, to ensure that packets make it through both the robot-side and field-side router. I’ve never had the time to experiment with this on a real field, though.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-05T17:35:22.866Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":80.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467265,"topic_slug":"does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets","display_username":"alst","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25570,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FiM CSA/etc."},"post_url":"/t/does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets/467265/3","custom_user_title":"FiM CSA/etc.","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3395649,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-05T17:37:34.554Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSo, every IP subnet has a “broadcast address” associated with it – it would be 10.TE.\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eAM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"AndyMark\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e.255 .  (Or, you can use 255.255.255.255.)   Ordinarily, if a device sends a UDP packet to a specific port at that address, then any other device on the local subnet can receive that UDP packet.   (You listen to that port number and, in Linux at least, set the SO_BROADCAST flag) .    I’m wondering if the virtual network communication between the robot and the driver station filters  out these packets, or if they get passed through.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-06-05T17:37:34.554Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":52.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467265,"topic_slug":"does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/does-field-pass-through-broadcast-packets/467265/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3395678,"name":"Travis Weir","username":"tweirtx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tweirtx/{size}/12204_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-05T18:32:36.822Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eTo my knowledge it would depend on the port.
